ch.usi.dag.dislre

Class REDispatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.usi.dag.dislre.REDispatch

  • public final class REDispatch
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides Shadow VM clients with an interface to register and invoke remote analysis methods.

    Each remote analysis method should be first registered by a call to the registerMethod(String) method, providing a fully qualified method name on the analysis server (without signature).

    To invoke that method later, either analysisStart(short) or analysisStart(short, byte) method should be called, followed by calls to appropriate send* methods. The invocation sequence should end with a call to analysisEnd() method.

    • Method Detail

      • registerMethod

        public static short registerMethod(java.lang.String fqMethodName)
        Registers a remote analysis method. Returns an identifier to be used in subsequent invocations to analysisStart(short) and analysisStart(short, byte) methods.
        Parameters:
        fqMethodName - fully qualified name of the method, without signature.
        Returns:
        remote method identifier.

      • analysisStart

        public static void analysisStart(short methodId)
        Marks the beginning of marshaling phase of the given analysis method invocation.
        Parameters:
        methodId - the identifier of the remote analysis method.

      • analysisStart

        public static void analysisStart(short methodId,
                                 byte orderingId)
        Marks the beginning of marshaling phase of the given analysis method invocation with the given ordering identifier. Analysis method invocations sharing the same ordering identifier will be mutually (globally) ordered.
        Parameters:
        methodId - the identifier of the remote analysis method.
        orderingId - the ordering identifier to associate the analysis method invocation with. Only non-negative values are valid.

      • analysisEnd

        public static void analysisEnd()
        Marks the end of the marshaling phase of analysis method invocation currently ongoing in the caller's thread.

        public static void sendBoolean(boolean value)

      • sendDouble

        public static void sendDouble(double value)

      • sendObject

        public static void sendObject(java.lang.Object object)
        Sends an object reference to the Shadow VM. The analysis method must expect to receive a ShadowObject.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to send.

      • sendObjectPlusData

        public static void sendObjectPlusData(java.lang.Object object)
        Sends an object reference to the Shadow VM, along with data payload containing values provided by special shadow objects such as ShadowString and ShadowThread.
        Parameters:
        object - object to send.

      • sendCurrentThread

        public static void sendCurrentThread()
        Sends the reference to the current thread to the Shadow VM, including null if the current thread does not exist yet.

        This is only useful to analyses that run very early during VM initialization. At that time, the call to Thread.currentThread() may actually return null, which cannot be sent to the analysis using the sendObject and sendObjectPlusData methods.

      • sendObjectSize

        public static void sendObjectSize(java.lang.Object object)
        Sends object size to the Shadow VM. The analysis method must expect to receive a long data type.
        Parameters:
        object - the object the size of which to send.
